comments.author: m2017

Let's spread the btc world to others, cheers.I consider the role of a BTC-missionary a waste of time and I believe that it is not needed by those who might be interested in bitcoin, and those who definitely will not be interested. Those people who are interested in finance, one way or another, have heard about bitcoin and can easily find all the information about this type of asset in the public domain. And it is useless to talk to those who definitely will not be interested in bitcoin and try to persuade them to invest. I am inclined to believe that such "agitation and propaganda" of bitcoin only pushes people away. Therefore, you should not force conversations on this topic. Unless people themselves ask to share their opinion and information if they find out that you have such.Those who need it, will "find the way" to BTC themselves.

comments.body: I have given bitcoin awareness so students in Baptist School and also people around me way back 2022. Currently, I don't talk much about bitcoin to people for my safety. comments.author: Alpha Marine
comments.body: I try to explain bitcoin to people. I'm glad that 3 people I have explained bitcoin to bought the idea and invested when they did. My very close friend is the most peculiar case. He was first convinced by a friend of his to buy a certain altcoin that it would give him a lot of profit in a short time, I didn't know about this arrangement and even then I wasn't into bitcoin, I wasn't even on the forum. Over a year later he was complaining to me about an investment he had made with a friend of his. He said he sent the guy money to buy a certain coin and he has not received a single profit from the coin, he just wants his money back and he doesn't care about any more profit.I was already in bitcoin now and that was when I began telling him that if he had left his money in bitcoin for over a year there was a higher chance he would have gotten profit. That was how I began educating him on bitcoin and how it was different from other coins. He read up and bought what I was selling. Somehow he got his money back from the guy and with my help, he set up his wallet and bought bitcoin. We are currently far away from each other but he calls me occasionally to tell me how much profit he has made and how he has invested more since the last time I saw him. Just recently he called to tell me how he took out profit from bicoin to solve an emergency he was faced with. I feel a little bit proud because he's not only just investing to make money but he totally understands the basics of bitcoin. He knows the risks and volatility, he bought his first bitcoin when it was about $40k or thereabout and he has seen how the price fluctuates so he understands. I'm also proud because he tries to correct misconceptions people might have about bitcoin and educate those around him. He currently has more bitcoin than me too. I feel like a proud teacher seeing his students doing well  I don't go about telling every Tom, Dick and Harry about bitcoin but if I see an opportunity where someone Im close to is interested I try to educate them on it and answer their questions. I also do not convince anybody to invest in bitcoin, it has to be their decision.
